subject: Re: Changing Softsynths
body: 17 (return) [ Liban. Orat. Parent. c. 50, p. 275, 276. A strange disorder, since it continued above seven years. In the factions of the Greek republics, the exiles amounted to 20,000 persons; and Isocrates assures Philip, that it would be easier to raise an army from the vagabonds than from the cities. See HumeÕs Essays, tom. i. p. 426, 427.]
